results.name: Binomial transform triangle, read by rows.
comment: Let P = Pascal's triangle as an infinite lower triangular matrix and A = the infinite array of arithmetic sequences as shown in A077028:
Perform the operation P * A, getting a new array with each column being the binomial transform of an arithmetic sequence. Take antidiagonals of the new array, then by rows = the triangle of A105851.
formula: n-th column of the triangle is the binomial transform of the arithmetic sequence (n*k + 1), (k = 0, 1, 2...).
example: Column 3: 1, 5, 16, 44, 112...(A053220) is the binomial transform of 3k+1 (A016777: 1, 4, 7,...).
mathematica: t[n_, k_]:=(2 + k (n - k)) 2^(n - k - 1); Table[t[n - 1, k - 1], {n, 10}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 26 2015 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[(2+k*(n-k))*2^(n-k-1): k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 26 2015
